entries.journal_entry_description: You've found some splinters of what appears to be a larger crystal. When you came close to some other splinters, the ones you had started pulsing and making a humming noise. As soon as you found the new splinters and put them together, they stopped. They all seem to have been part of the same crystal. You've collected enough of them now that you can puzzle together a symmetrical crystal but how do you fuse the parts together?
entries.task00_journal_entry_description: You think you've found all the fragments of the crystal but how do you fuse them back together? You're guessing it would take a machine with an extreme heat and energy output.
entries.task01_journal_entry_description: Wait for the photon fusion machine to finish the process.
entries.task02_journal_entry_description: The process is complete, hopefully it worked.
entries.task03_message_box_text: The fusion process seems to have worked, the crystal is now complete and the amount of energy streaming out from it into your hands as you grab it is almost overwhelming.
